organization.fullName: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

identificationModule.briefTitle: tACS for Sensory Motor Recovery After Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: tACS Brain Neuromodulation for Sensory and Motor Recovery After Neurological Impairments

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

leadSponsor.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The overall goal is to investigate the effectiveness of a novel intervention - transcranial alternating current stimulation (tACS) for motor recovery in stroke survivors.

armGroups.label: tACS Sham, tACS 10Hz, tACS 20Hz
armGroups.description:
tACS Sham is a temporary non-invasive electrical stimulation that applies a weak oscillatory current to the brain through the scalp for up to 30 second, it is not designed to entrain neuronal activity into any external regulatory frequency patterns.

tACS 10Hz is a 10Hz non-invasive electrical stimulation that applies a weak oscillatory current to the brain through the scalp or 20 or 40 minutes to entrain neuronal activity into 10Hz frequency patterns.

tACS 20Hz is a 20Hz non-invasive electrical stimulation that applies a weak oscillatory current to the brain through the scalp for 20 or 40 minutes to entrain neuronal activity into 20Hz frequency patterns.

armGroups.label: HD-tACS 20Hz, HD-tACS 10Hz, HD-tACS Sham
armGroups.description:
tACS Sham is a temporary non-invasive electrical stimulation that applies a weak oscillatory current to the brain through the scalp for up to 30 second, it is not designed to entrain neuronal activity into any external regulatory frequency patterns.

tACS 10Hz is a 10Hz non-invasive electrical stimulation that applies a weak oscillatory current to the brain through the scalp or 20 or 40 minutes to entrain neuronal activity into 10Hz frequency patterns.

tACS 20Hz is a 20Hz non-invasive electrical stimulation that applies a weak oscillatory current to the brain through the scalp for 20 or 40 minutes to entrain neuronal activity into 20Hz frequency patterns.

armGroups.label: HD-tACS 10Hz, HD-tACS 20Hz, HD-tACS Sham

tACS Sham is a temporary non-invasive electrical stimulation that applies a weak oscillatory current to the brain through the scalp for up to 30 second, it is not designed to entrain neuronal activity into any external regulatory frequency patterns.

tACS 10Hz is a 10Hz non-invasive electrical stimulation that applies a weak oscillatory current to the brain through the scalp or 20 or 40 minutes to entrain neuronal activity into 10Hz frequency patterns.

interventions.name: tACS Sham
interventions.description: Sham tACS will applied to the brain through the scalp for 20 minutes.

interventions.name: tACS 10Hz
interventions.description: 10Hz tACS will applied to the brain through the scalp for 20 minutes.

interventions.name: tACS 20Hz
interventions.description: 20Hz tACS will applied to the brain through the scalp for 20 minutes.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Block and Box Test (BBT) of Motor functional test
primaryOutcomes.description: The Box and Block Test (BBT) measures unilateral gross manual dexterity. It is a quick and simple test used with a wide range of populations, including clients with stroke.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change of BBT performance 5 minutes before and 5 minutes after the tACS intervention will be measured.

primaryOutcomes.measure: EEG alpha band and Beta band
primaryOutcomes.description: Electroencephalography (EEG) is valuable to infer and evaluate the neural interaction. Components of the alpha and beta frequency bands like the sensorimotor rhythm originated from the primary motor cortex and related brain areas reflect human movement. The power of 8-13 Hz alpha and 14-30 Hz beta frequency bands will be used for the classification.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change of EEG alpha band and Beta band 5 minutes before and 5 minutes after the tACS intervention will be measured.

overallOfficials.name: Sheng Li, MD, Ph.D
